# setInputMuted(_:)

**Instance Method**

Sets a Boolean value that indicates whether the app’s audio input is in a muted state.

## Declaration

```swift
func setInputMuted(_ muted: Bool) throws
```

## Parameters

- **muted**: A Boolean value that indicates the new mute state.

## Discussion

In platforms that use [doc://com.apple.avfaudio/documentation/AVFAudio/AVAudioSession], setting the value to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] mutes all sources of audio input in the app. In macOS, the system instead invokes the callback that you register by calling [doc://com.apple.avfaudio/documentation/AVFAudio/AVAudioApplication/setInputMuteStateChangeHandler(_:)] to handle input muting.



## Managing audio input mute state

- **isInputMuted**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the app’s audio input is in a muted state.
- **inputMuteStateChangeNotification**: A notification the system posts when the app’s audio input mute state changes.
- **setInputMuteStateChangeHandler(_:)**: Sets a callback to handle changes to application-level audio muting states.
